objects.name: Earth
objects.description: Our home planet, the third planet from the Sun and the only known celestial body to harbor life
educationalFacts: Earth is the only known planet with liquid water on its surface
70% of Earth's surface is covered by oceans
Earth's atmosphere protects us from harmful solar radiation

objects.name: The Moon
objects.description: Earth's only natural satellite, the fifth-largest moon in the Solar System
educationalFacts: The Moon's gravity causes Earth's ocean tides
The same side of the Moon always faces Earth
The Moon is slowly drifting away from Earth at about 3.8 cm per year

objects.name: The Sun
objects.description: Our solar system's star, containing 99.86% of the system's mass
educationalFacts: The Sun is approximately 4.6 billion years old
Light from the Sun takes about 8 minutes to reach Earth
The Sun's core temperature is about 15 million degrees Celsius
The Sun converts 4 million tons of matter into energy every second

objects.name: Mercury
objects.description: The smallest planet and closest to the Sun, with extreme temperature variations
educationalFacts: Mercury has no atmosphere to retain heat
A day on Mercury lasts 59 Earth days
Mercury's surface is covered with craters like the Moon
Temperature swings from -173°C to 427°C

objects.name: Venus
objects.description: Earth's 'sister planet' with a thick toxic atmosphere and extreme greenhouse effect
educationalFacts: Venus has the hottest surface of any planet at 462°C
Venus rotates backwards compared to most planets
A day on Venus is longer than its year
Venus is the brightest planet in Earth's night sky

objects.name: Mars
objects.description: The Red Planet, fourth from the Sun and a primary target for human exploration
educationalFacts: Mars has the largest volcano in the solar system: Olympus Mons
A day on Mars (sol) is 24 hours and 37 minutes
Mars has two small moons: Phobos and Deimos

objects.name: Jupiter
objects.description: The largest planet in our solar system, a gas giant with a famous Great Red Spot storm
educationalFacts: Jupiter has 95 known moons, including the four large Galilean moons
The Great Red Spot is a storm larger than Earth that has raged for centuries
Jupiter's mass is 2.5 times that of all other planets combined
A day on Jupiter is only 10 hours long despite its huge size

objects.name: Saturn
objects.description: The ringed planet, a gas giant famous for its spectacular ring system
educationalFacts: Saturn's rings are made of ice and rock particles
Saturn has 146 known moons, the most of any planet
Saturn is the least dense planet - it would float in water
Saturn's rings are only about 10 meters thick on average

objects.name: Uranus
objects.description: An ice giant that rotates on its side, giving it extreme seasonal variations
educationalFacts: Uranus rotates on its side at a 98-degree tilt
Uranus was the first planet discovered with a telescope (1781)
A year on Uranus is 84 Earth years
Uranus has 13 known rings and 27 known moons

objects.name: Neptune
objects.description: The farthest planet from the Sun, an ice giant with the fastest winds in the solar system
educationalFacts: Neptune has the strongest winds in the solar system, up to 2,100 km/h
Neptune takes 165 Earth years to orbit the Sun
Neptune was discovered mathematically before being observed
Neptune has 16 known moons, the largest being Triton

objects.name: Pluto
objects.description: A dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt, formerly considered the ninth planet
educationalFacts: Pluto was reclassified as a dwarf planet in 2006
Pluto's largest moon, Charon, is more than half Pluto's size
It takes Pluto 248 Earth years to orbit the Sun
NASA's New Horizons spacecraft visited Pluto in 2015

objects.name: Proxima Centauri
objects.description: The closest star to our Solar System, a red dwarf in the Alpha Centauri system
educationalFacts: Proxima Centauri is only 4.24 light-years from Earth
It's about 7 times smaller than the Sun
Proxima Centauri has at least one exoplanet: Proxima b
Light from Proxima Centauri takes 4.24 years to reach Earth

objects.name: Andromeda Galaxy
objects.description: The nearest major galaxy to the Milky Way, on a collision course with our galaxy
educationalFacts: Andromeda will collide with the Milky Way in about 4.5 billion years
Contains about 1 trillion stars (compared to Milky Way's 200-400 billion)
Visible to the naked eye from Earth on clear, dark nights
Approximately 200,000 light-years in diameter
